name: 廖天豪
objective:
This course offers complex variables knowledge for engineering application.
It covers following topics.

1.Complex Numbers
2.Complex Functions
3.Harmonic Functions
4.Complex Integration
5.Cauchy Theory of Integration 
6.Complex Power Series
7.Laurent Series,Residues
8.Conformal Mapping
schedule:
Ｗeek 1 Complex Numbers and Their Geometric Representation & Polar Form of Complex Numbers. Powers and Roots
Ｗeek 2 Derivative. Analytic Function & Cauchy–Riemann Equations. Laplace’s Equation
Ｗeek 3 Exponential Function & Trigonometric and Hyperbolic Functions. Euler’ s Formula
Ｗeek 4 Logarithm. General Power. Principal Value & Line Integral in the Complex Plane
Ｗeek 5 Cauchy’ s Integral Theorem & Cauchy’ s Integral Formula
Ｗeek 6 Derivatives of Analytic Functions & Sequences, Series, Convergence Tests
Ｗeek 7 Power Series & Functions Given by Power Series
Ｗeek 8 Taylor and Maclaurin Series & Uniform Convergence. Optional
Ｗeek 9 Mid-term
Ｗeek 10 Laurent Series & Singularities and Zeros. Infinity
Ｗeek 11 Residue Integration Method & Residue Integration of Real Integrals
Ｗeek 12 Geometry of Analytic Functions: Conformal Mapping & Linear Fractional Transformations (Möbius Transformations)
Ｗeek 13 Special Linear Fractional Transformations & Conformal Mapping by Other Functions
Ｗeek 14 Riemann Surfaces. Optional & Electrostatic Fields
Ｗeek 15 Use of Conformal Mapping. Modeling & Heat Problems
Ｗeek 16 Fluid Flow & Poisson’ s Integral Formula for Potentials
Ｗeek 17 General Properties of Harmonic Functions. Uniqueness Theorem for the Dirichlet Problem
Ｗeek 18 Final
materials:
E. Kreyszig, H. Kreyszig, and E. J. Norminton, Advanced Engineering Mathematics, Tenth. Hoboken, NJ: Wiley, 2011.

CHAPTER 13 Complex Numbers and Functions. Complex Differentiation
CHAPTER 14 Complex Integration
CHAPTER 15 Power Series, Taylor Series
CHAPTER 16 Laurent Series. Residue Integration
CHAPTER 17 Conformal Mapping
CHAPTER 18 Complex Analysis and Potential Theory
